Reviews.Title: “Cheating hotel - Avoid Central Inn Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Moonbabyxox
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Booking.com, I booked 1 comfort apartment as Booking.com showed photos of a nice spacious bedroom and a nice spacious living room and it was clearly written that "Comfort apartments feature 2 bathrooms". I liked the photos and booked 1 Comfort Apartment for single use for 7 nights. And when I checked in yesterday the hotel staff who barely spoke English demanded me to pay 100% upfront, and I paid as I trusted in Booking.com! And then she brought me to this tiny room at the end of the corridor! It was a tiny tiny room with a single bed and a tiny tiny living room! It wasn't the promised Comfort Apartment with spacious bedroom with a double bed and a nice big living room! So here I am stuck in this terrible hotel, the hotel staff are very rude and barely speak English... I don't know if it's Booking.com who provide people with false info or if it's this Central Inn hotel who cheat people! Avoid Central Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pretty Happy”
Reviews.Author: fearlessbobfunkhouse
Reviews.Content: Certainly not the best hotel I have stayed in but it was clean and in a good location and good value for money. I was asked to pay upon arrival which was a bit strange but all in all very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel, clean room, very good location”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: I had no problem with this hotel. I would recomend it. Good ration price-quality. I was asked to pay when I arrived. I paid in cash. The biggest advantage is the location of the hotel. It's very close to Central Train Station (walk cca 10 minutes). Bus stop is located in front of hotel. I was accommodated in a single room with shower and WC. They changed towels every day. Room and bathroom was clean. Only wifi signal in the room was weak, but worked. Breakfast in next-door restaurant was sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: dai0812
Reviews.Content: Having arrived late in the evening, my colleagues warned me not to look too closely at everything! How true they were, the hotel is dark and tired, my room absolutely stank of smoke, so much I couldnt sleep, rooms are so small that I couldnt even stretch my arms out without touching both walls and the bathroom was even smaller!! We managed 1 night there and had to leave. It took us over 1 hour to check out, and we had to pay 80 % of the remaining 4 days, but it was worth it just to leave!

Reviews.Title: “look for another place”
Reviews.Author: u_serial
Reviews.Content: despite of the location near the Hauptbahnhof and the photos on the internet, where the hotel looks nice the hotel sucks. the rooms are old and small (about 10 sqm), you can sit on the toilet and brush your teeth. the rooms have windows to the back which is very loud even at night, because you hear everything in the backyard from other departments (music, vacuum cleaner, etc). the service is very bad and inflexible. be prepared to pay in cash with the exact amount!! (unbelievable) i certainly will not come back to this place and I advise everyone to stay away to avoid annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: ldeit
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights...for people used to traveling budget in Europe, this hotel was great. It was a short walk to the Hauptbahnhof. I was a little worried from the outside at first, but that was just the "Holiday Inn American" in me. The 4-person room had plenty of space. The room & the bathroom were spotless. We paid the extra 5Euros a person for the breakfast (available on the weekend) from the restaurant attached and it was great - breads, marinated vegetables, scrambled eggs, cereal, among other things - not what I was used to getting from typical German breakfast. It's not luxury, but good, clean, affordable pension in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: tampajeep
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. Reviews are over-rated. If we had not been so tired I would have gladly let the 80EU go down the drain. Be advised: if you see the word "tenant" or any part of the word, STAY AWAY. This place was really bad; not really dirty but...awful.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Central Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Alt-Moabit 126, 10557 Berlin, Germany
